parameters.definition: Number of toys produced per day by a medium-sized factory
Number of operators required for a medium-sized factory
Number of toys produced per day by a small factory
Number of operators required for a small factory
Minimum number of toys to be produced per day

description: A toy company can build two factory types, a medium-sized factory and a small factory. A medium-sized factory can make \param{ToysMedium} toys per day and requires \param{OperatorsMedium} operators. A small factory can make \param{ToysSmall} toys per day and requires \param{OperatorsSmall} operators. The company must make at least \param{ToysMin} toys per day but they only have \param{OperatorsTotal} operators available. How many of each factory should the company build to minimize the total number of factories?
